content.description: Climb about 15 to 20 ft. of nice finger jammin to a small ledge, then a tight crack to the roof. Pul through the roof and finish the crack to the top.
content.location: Starts about 15' left of where a landslide intersects with the cliffline.

content.description: Face climb. Climb through some thin cracks  that soon come to a stop. Climb right on a nice slab and finish to the top.
content.location: Starts about 175' left of On Any Sunday.

content.description: Named after Shelob, the offspring of Ungoliant, a great spider of Mordor during the Third Age of Middle Earth. Look out for giant spider webs as you ascend this monster right-facing corner. Finish by traversing out the roof to the right.
content.protection: standard rack with medium gear; wizard staff AKA spider stick
content.location: left of the approach gully; directly right of Rockwork Orange.

content.description: sramble to a ledge, past two roofs and a hand jamming crack. Then up to the right with some slab climbing.
One of the Chattanooga area's finest, most aesthetically pleasing 5.10's. A short moderate crack leads to a recess. Climb left facing corner above.Â
Start on a ledge. Climb a nice black roof with nice jams.(10ft.)
content.location: At the top of Star Search.

content.description:
Scamper up a crack and then right via a ramp to a superb corner that rivals any in the greater Chattanooga area. Three stars on the assumption that if more people climb it, the better it will clean up.  

  A great "southern 8;" the lichen makes it feel a bit harder.
content.protection: Standard rack with an emphasis on the small stuff. Slung tree with a locker up top, good as of 2.4.17
content.location: Furthest right portion of the wall before the Auschwitz area.

content.description: The Upper Passes' Main Wall contains a variety of climbing, including one of the earliest known routes at Suck Creek:  Shelob (5.8), orginally done as an aid line in the 1970s.  Other highlights include Rockwork Orange (5.9) and The Cauldron (5.11c/d).
